intro: Humbertioturraea baronii, commonly known as the Baroni's turraea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
